text: Depending how one interprets that, it could be that the system is incapable of scheduling publish dates in the past, if that is what you are trying to get it to do here...
Sadly, there is a lot of stuff they have on `<http://api.HubSpot.com|api.HubSpot.com>` which is not available to us external users on `<http://hubapi.com|hubapi.com>`
Generally, yes, if it does not show up in the first link with the V3 Docs, you have to use whatever is on legacydocs, and if it does not appear on legacydocs, you are hosed.

It could be that it is not connected to a pipeline, or is connected to a bogus pipeline, or your UI view has a filter which is excluding it unexpectedly. You can also check the contents of the response, which should generally return back the payload that actually got created, including the ID of the object.

Also, when verifying if it was created did you use a UI or an API? Be sure to check both in case some filtering issue made it not show up.

Paging is the only way, for performance reasons. You'd need to make some logic which does a loop. Depending on the language you are using HubSpot publishes client libs that would reduce the tedium involved
Like William asked, we need a lot more data about what you are doing in the API to reply to this.
